title: Daniella Westbrook shares emotional missing person plea on Twitter
text:

Former EastEnders actress Daniella Westbrook has taken to Twitter to ask for her followers help in finding a missing person.

Daniella's daughter's friend's mother has been missing for over 24 hours, with only her bag and phone found.

Daniella wrote: "Dear all, I NEED YOUR HELP TO FIND MY DAUGHTERS FRIENDS MOTHER MISSING OVER 24 HOURS, HER BAG AND PHONE FOUND BUT NEED HELP FINDING HER ASAP. HER DAUGHTER NEEDS TO KNOW SHE'S OK. Contact @JessDurrantxx Please Share on all social media platforms. Many thanks. #BringHerHome."

Alongside the tweet, she shared screenshots of the missing woman's daughter's Instagram story, asking for help in finding her.

One, alongside a photo of her mum, reads: "My mum has been missing for almost 24 hours. Her bag with phone and purse have been found but she has not.

"Please anyone in the Henley/Reading area keep an eye out and contact the police immediately if you see or know anything.

"This is completely out of character."

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

Another photo is captioned: "Please if anyone is in or around Henley area and can come and help search even if it's just for an hour. Please check river banks and weeds and any area around the water."

There's been an outpouring of support and well wishes on Twitter for the search.

One wrote: "I do hope you find her safe and sound. Please let us know if you do, nothing worse than a family member gone missing, hope you are keeping well and looking after yourself."

Another said: "Prayers for her, hope she is found safe. And for her Daughter and all concerned."
description: Daniella took to the site to beg everyone to help find her daughter's friend's mother, who's been missing for over 24 hours
